raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hey, whats up?

System: well, I'm not sure I'm the best for the job, but I can try!
User: I was not able to figure out the last few slides. I think its best to discuss this in person. Do you have time right now?
System: I'm afraid not, right now I'm in a meeting and I'll be going for lunch afterwards. How about tomorrow at noon?
User: No problem! Sure. We still have plenty of time for the test. Anyways, how's your preparation going?
System: not feeling too sure about it tbh. I've been super busy so I haven't study much :(. I might join some of the study sessions later
User: Same feeling here! But i think the syllabus may not that tough. You may be able to cover it up over the weekend.

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How's it going?
User: Good. My wallet is recovering from the spending of the holidays, haha. Hbu?
System: Nice! I'm doing well!
User: I am looking to save money on any future shopping. Where do you like to shop?
System: I like to shop at Five Below, Sally's Beauty Supply, and Old Navy. How about you?
User: I love Sur La Table and Macy's. They're decent quality. What do you normally buy at Old Navy?
System: I'll have to check out Macy's! I like their socks, lol. What about you?
User: Oh the socks are super cute. Especially the ones with little animals on them!!
System: I'll have to check it out! Thanks for the suggestions!
User: Yeah, np!

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: start over
System: You start.
User: Can we talk about human relationships ?
System: Sure, human relationships sounds like a good topic. . I like kebabs.
User: Kebab is food, not a relationship
System: . Oh kebabs taste lovely but they are not very healthy for you.
User: I love a kebab but I would not make love to it
System: Well my favourite kebab is a free one that someone buys me! You love a kebab. What do you like about it so much? No one says you have to.
User: I'm actually not into kebabs at all
System: Oh, I love them. They are yummy.
User: can we not talk about food

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hello, Nice to meet you
System: If you could eat only one food for the rest of time, what would it be?
User: Hmm... That's a tough one. I think I would go Asian Food > Chinese Food > Stirfry. What about you?
System: I think ice-cream. It may not be good for me, but I wouldn't care, haha
User: I love ice cream too!
System: Okay, top three flavors?
User: I like vanilla more than chocolate ice cream. I typically will do any variations on vanilla. To pick from the top of my head, I would say Cookies and Cream, Mint Chocolate Chip, and Coffee. How about you?
System: Ah, that's a good way of framing it. Me, I like berries: boysenberry one, strawberry two, maybe straight chocolate number 3 to mix it up a bit.
User: Very nice. I love sorbet's and smoothies. Changing topics, Do you believe in an afterlife?
System: Yes. I wonder if I'm in it right now. How would I know? What do you think?
User: I think so. I feel there must be something more than the physical world as we understand it.
System: There's a mental world, I suppose? Understanding itself
User: What is the most supernatural experience you have ever had?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how are you doing?
User: Okay, I guess
System: Just ok? What's wrong?
User: I damaged my car today on accident
System: Oh no! What happened?
User: I scraped against a wall when another car crossed into my lane
System: Yikes! Glad you're okay!
User: Thanks! I'm not looking forward to the repair cost
System: Me either! That's no fun.
User: I can't wait until we all get to use driverless cars
System: Me neither! I really want one!
User: Do you think we will own driverless cars or just rent them, like taxis?

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: You must be new around here!
System: Not really. I am REDACTED_TERM years old.
User: Oh, I meant this neighborhood, not the planet earth! haha
System: I hate one word answers. It's ok. I understood you anyway. Why are you laughing?
User: I didn't give a one word answer!
System: That was a bit mean of you.
User: What was?
System: That thing we mentioned earlier.
User: Which thing?
System: The first one, I think.
User: Can you quote it? I don't know what you are referring to...
System: Only at formal occasions. I was referring to what you just said.
User: Okay. I am kind of lost to be honest.
System: Oh. I appreciate honesty. What is it that confuses you?
User: You don't seem to be making any sense.

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?
User: Very busy and you?
System: Busy but good. What are you busy with?
User: work, I need to finish bunch of stuff before the day ends
System: Ah, well good luck with that!
User: thanks
System: You're welcome! How's your day been?
User: so far so good, couple meetings and coding
System: Sounds like a productive day to me!
User: I agree
System: So how are the meetings going?
User: going well, trying to move the projects

Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
